You've never played Dota, then. There's about 4 heroes that can overlap their stealth cds; Invoker, Clinkz, Bounty Hunter, and Riki who has perma stealth but a long fade duration which he can't take dmg or it cancels the duration. 

Invoker has a high skill floor and he's naturally hard to play. His stuns come from his QWE ability, but that is weak if you want to have perma stealth. 

Clinkz is basically an ADC, similar to Twitch but with fire instead of poison. 

Bounty Hunter doesn't have any cc, either, except for a very very short stun on his Q, but that can't be spammed or used a lot because of it's high mana cost and the fact BH is an agility carry that doesn't build a lot of intel of mana items. 

Riki has an AoE silence similar to Twitch W; step outside the smoke and you aren't silenced anymore. Riki doesn't have any escapes besides his ult, so hard cc from any source destroys him since he's squishy. 


There's nothing bad about having to buy an item to counter something. Dota is all about countering, whether it be counter-picking or itemizing against someone's abilities (like MKB and PA). Dota doesn't really care about counterplay as much as league does since counterpicking is a viable strat to be utilized. You could say that a meepo has no counterplay vs an Earthshaker, but that's because the person was dumb enough to pick Meepo while earthshaker wasn't banned or picked by their own team. 

Dota's picking phase holds a lot more weight that League's as the fate of the game can be decided there if you are dumb with your picks or pick orders.
